column4: How can I boot without video drivers? A friend of mine is having trouble
you can still boot into recovery mode, command line only
in recovery mode you could use some generic drivers in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf like "driver "vesa"" and at least have low resolution graphical interface
sounds like maye you need to restore from a backup /etc/X11/xorg.conf if there is one
none what? no xorg.conf?  no xorg.conf backups with the date on them?
oh the perils of not making backups.  Well, you can edit xorg.conf and in the device section change "driver nvidia" to driver nv
that would backup his current one, and then overwrite his current one with the other backup
there should be a recovery mode at grub
can he at least get into recovery mode?
then he needs to edit his /etc/X11/xorg.conf file and in the device section change "driver "nvidia"" to "driver "nv"", if he has an nvidia card
